intro: Stranvaesia rosthornii, commonly known as the Cape rosebay, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. It has small, leathery leaves and produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Stranvaesia rosthornii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
